unnormalised: **New Wheels Galore: Automotive Sector Heats Up!**
normalised: **New Wheels Galore: Automotive Sector Heats Up!**

unnormalised: Namaste, auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing with new vehicle launches faster than a Mumbai local train at rush hour!
normalised: Namaste, auto enthusiasts! The Indian automotive market is buzzing with new vehicle launches faster than a Mumbai local train at rush hour!

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its much-awaited "Scorpio N Pickup" – a beast built for both rugged terrain and the city streets. Expect serious competition for the Isuzu D-Max.
normalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its much-awaited "Scorpio N Pickup" – a beast built for both rugged terrain and the city streets. Expect serious competition for the Isuzu D-Max.

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with the "Punch CNG," adding a fuel-efficient option to their already popular micro-SUV. Perfect for those Delhi traffic jams, right?
normalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with the "Punch C N G," adding a fuel-efficient option to their already popular micro-S U V. Perfect for those Delhi traffic jams, right?

unnormalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki teased the next-gen "Alto 800," promising a fresh design and improved mileage. The rumour mill suggests it will come with an all-new engine, developed with help from Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University.
normalised: Not to be left behind, Maruti Suzuki teased the next-gen "Alto eight hundred," promising a fresh design and improved mileage. The rumour mill suggests it will come with an all-new engine, developed with help from Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Technological University.

unnormalised: On the luxury front, BMW launched the new "7 Series" in India, boasting features like a massive panoramic screen and enough legroom to stretch out like you're relaxing on a houseboat in Kerala. The starting price is a cool Rs. 1.7 Cr.
normalised: On the luxury front, B M W launched the new "seven Series" in India, boasting features like a massive panoramic screen and enough legroom to stretch out like you're relaxing on a houseboat in Kerala. The starting price is a cool rupee one point seven crore.

unnormalised: And finally, a homegrown electric scooter company, Ather Energy, announced expansion plans, targeting a showroom presence of 500 sq ft per outlet in tier-2 cities. Exciting times ahead!
normalised: And finally, a homegrown electric scooter company, Ather Energy, announced expansion plans, targeting a showroom presence of five hundred square feet per outlet in tier-two cities. Exciting times ahead!
